title: Momento 2015 White (Western Cape)
description: Bright, clean aromas of apple flesh, green melon, quinine, lanolin and straw lead the charge on the nose of this precise wine. Medium in weight, vibrant acidity and a slightly pithy texture frame the ripe citrus and apple tones, while the finish returns to a pleasantly herbal, grassy impression. Drink now–2022.

title: Pflüger 2016 Quarzit Trocken Weissburgunder (Pfalz)
description: Zippy and fresh, this dry, medium-bodied Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, offers loads of pristine apple and tangerine-peel flavors. It's concentrated yet sprightly in mouthfeel and finishes with lingering complexities of sea salt and smoky nuts. Drink now through 2022.

title: Rocca di Frassinello 2015  Maremma Toscana
description: Made with 60% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers aromas of black currant, underbrush and green peppercorn. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and ground black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Spectrum Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This cuvée has a bit less new oak than its companions and seems a tad less ripe, though certainly ripe enough. There's a tart streak of pineapple and orange under firm red-currant fruit. A light hint of char and chocolate wraps up the finish.

title: Schmidt 2014 Touriga Nacional (Southern Oregon)
description: A real success, in part because the alcohol has been kept in check, this palate-pleaser brings flavors of cranberry sauce, dried orange peel, clove and dark chocolate. It's balanced and bright, forward and chockful of pretty spices.

title: Trizanne 2015 Reserve Syrah (Elim)
description: This is currently a bit shy and reserved, begging for a bit more time to better express itself. Notes of black cherry and currant are hit by accents of espresso powder and baking spice, white the palate offers a slightly jammier impression that lingers through the medium-length finish. The tannins are structured and youthful, yet resolve themselves somewhat easily alongside the ripe fruit tones. Give this a couple of years; try after 2020.

title: Wittmann 2016 100 Hills Dry Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Hints of honey and orange blossom soften cutting lime and lemon flavors in this medium-bodied Riesling. Dry in style, it's a zesty, intensely thirst quenching wine, with a long finish fringed by bitter, waxy lime-pith complexities. Drink now through 2020.

title: Château Escot 2015  Médoc
description: This ripe wine with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon is solid and firm both with tannins and wood aging. The juicy black currants that shine through reflect the vintage. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Château Fleur la Mothe 2015  Médoc
description: The 30% new barrels really show in this toasty, spicy wine. This intense wood aging is saved by the rich underlying fruit that delivers great concentration and blackberry flavors. Given time these will balance with the wood, produce a ripe, fruity wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Château la Haye 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: The 16th-century Scottish baronial-style chateau is surrounded by a 45-acre vineyard that gives structured wines like this. It has the richness of the year although it has not lost the ripe tannins and dark fruits. It needs to age, so drink this firm wine from 2024.

title: Château la Tour de Mons 2015  Margaux
description: From vines in the northern part of the Margaux, this wine has some of the attractive perfumed quality of the appellation layered on a powerfully dark, structured character. Rich both in fruit and tannins this ripe wine will need time to develop. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Lamothe-Bergeron 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This concentrated wine, with its combination of juicy black-currant fruit and rich tannins, is set to age well. Weighty and concentrated while also crisp and fruity, it displays excellent balance with its dusty tannins never hiding the fruitiness. Drink from 2023.

title: Château le Temple 2015  Médoc
description: The dominance of Cabernet Sauvignon in this structured wine shows in the firm tannins, the ripe black-currant fruit and the elegance of a wine that is both ripe and firm. It will develop well and will be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This elegant wine is rich, with lightly structured black fruits that reveal the generosity of the vintage and also the aging potential. Powered by the juicy black-currant fruit of the Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a wine to age. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Plantier Rose 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: The 15 months in wood shows strongly in this wine, yet the ripe black fruits are more than a match for the spice and toast flavors. With a blend dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine shows a black-currant tone supported by structured tannins that add to the concentration. Drink from 2023.

title: 2Hawk NV Plume Blanc v.1 White (Rogue Valley)
description: Lush aromatics lead into a complex wine with a compelling and rich play of pear, peach, nectarine, guava and papaya. A touch beyond bone dry at 7 g/L residual sugar, this blend of Viognier, Marsanne and Roussanne is a lovely break from the typical white wines of the region.

title: Adega Mãe 2014 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)
description: This Touriga Nacional is sourced from vineyards close to the Atlantic Ocean and as a result it gets a touch of saltiness to its rich tannins. The wine has power and density, with rich black fruits and violet tones. It is still young and will be best from 2019.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2016 Esencia Diviña Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Minerally aromas are balanced by light, elegant fruit scents akin to applesauce and pear. This feels refined on a palate that's only slightly pulpy. A fruit-bowl's worth of stylish citrus and apple flavors are lasting on the finish. Drink now.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A subtle note of ripe, red cherry plays on the nose, along with the merest hint of conifer that becomes more vivid on the palate. The body is slender, light and unforced. This is a very honest, easy and traditional Pinot, made with an admirably light touch.

title: Argentiera 2015  Bolgheri Superiore
description: Made with 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc, this offers aromas of ripe blackberry, bell pepper and a hint of coconut. The rich palate doles out black-currant jam, licorice and a touch of espresso alongside polished velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Atticus 2015 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Creamy flavors of strawberry puree and milk chocolate are given some extra zing with hints of bitter black tea. The ample tannins provide heft and added length, and the wine will drink nicely now through the mid-2020s.

title: Barons 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Though not labeled as such, all of this fruit comes from Rosebud Vineyard on the Wahluke Slope. Blended with 16% Sémillon, which shows itself, the aromas are light, with notes of citrus, fig, pineapple, lees and herb. The flavors are broad and textured with an extended finish. It's as much about feel as flavor.

title: Bartinney 2015 Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)
description: This is a woody and toasty pour, with forward scents of baked apple, yellow melon, peach pit and toasted hazelnut to immediately greet you. The supple, creamy palate offers ample acidity to balance the wine's rich flavors, while final notes of orange cream and apple pie hang on through the close. Drink now–2022.

title: Bastgen 2016 Blauschiefer Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pristine and primary, this is a juicy off-dry Riesling, offering buoyant pink-grapefruit flavor edged by lime hints of caramelized sugar. It's a plucky, spirited wine with a lingering lime-pith finish.

title: Bel Lago 2013 North Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Perfumed aromas of cherry, anise, licorice and dried rose burst from the glass. Light in body and with vibrant acidity, the palate offers tart red-cherry and cranberry flavors broadened by cedar, baking spice and velvety tannins. The medium-length finish is sultry, with notes of brandied cherries and cedar spice.

title: Château Suau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Soft, already open and generous, this is a lightly textured and crisp wine. It has a bright character along with some tangy spice and pepper flavors. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Malescasse 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This is a structured wine, with dense, dry tannins from both the concentrated fruit and the wood aging. It has the potential to be rich, but is also cut by intense acidity. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Maucaillou 2017 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. A prominent black currant aroma and ripe tannins give this wine a fine balance. The core is dry and firm, exhibiting the potential to age and certainly offering final richness. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Rahoul 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Juicy and ripe with fine swathes of blackberry fruit, this is bold, fruity wine with generous, full-bodied character. The tannins are soft, indicating this generous wine is likely to mature soon.

title: Château la Garde 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Layers of black currant fruit offer a fruity, fragrant wine. It is fresh and juicy, with a crisp texture and a touch of spice. Drink this attractive wine from 2022.
